summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 and earlier (dating back to 2019) between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss the transfer, scanning, and cataloging of discovery materials, including CDs, from the Florida case. The correspondence is logistical, focusing on ensuring a complete set of documents for review.

persons.name: Alba
persons.role: FBI Unit Chief, Litigation Support Unit/RIDS
persons.context: Appears as the FBI contact responding to inquiries about processing Epstein investigation materials, specifically from the FOIA/media team.

connections.description: Alba's FBI unit was responsible for transmitting scanned investigation records to S, as part of discovery coordination.

events.title: Email follow-up on Epstein materials
events.description: An email chain discusses follow-ups on the processing and transfer of Epstein investigation materials, including CDs from Florida.

events.title: Check-in on record transmission
events.description: An email checks on the transmission of scanned records, inquiring whether 16,000 or 29,000 pages were sent and requesting an index of materials.

events.title: Coordination call follow-up
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up on a conversation, providing contact information and offering to set up another call to discuss records related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI's Litigation Support Unit was involved in processing and transmitting discovery materials from the Epstein investigation in Florida to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The materials included CDs and scanned documents, with discussions about the volume (16,000 vs. 29,000 pages) and the need for a complete catalog.
The correspondence highlights logistical coordination between law enforcement and prosecutors regarding evidence handling in the Epstein case.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York was actively involved in coordinating the receipt and review of these materials in early 2019.
